intro: Aconitum vulparia subsp. penninum, commonly known as the European monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple hooded flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive veining pattern, and its roots are tuberous. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
